options.name: server
options.description: This includes configurations required for configuring the deployment parameters that are used for identifying an API Manager server node.

params.name: hostname
params.description: The hostname or IP address of the machine hosting the API Manager instance.

params.name: offset
params.description:
Port offset allows you to run multiple WSO2 products, multiple instances of a WSO2 product, or multiple WSO2 product clusters on the same server or virtual machine (VM). 

 Port offset defines the number by which all ports defined in the runtime such as the HTTP/S ports will be offset. For example, if the default HTTP port is 9443 and the port offset is 1, the effective HTTP port will be 9444. Therefore, for each additional WSO2 product instance, set the port offset to a unique value so that they can all run on the same server without any port conflicts.

params.name: server_role
params.description: The profile name of the API Manager instance.

params.name: enableMTOM
params.description: Use this paramater to enable MTOM (Message Transmission Optimization Mechanism) for the product server.

params.name: enableSwA
params.description: Use this paramater to enable SwA (SOAP with Attachments) for the product server. When SwA is enabled, the API Manager will process the files attached to SOAP messages.

params.name: disable_shutdown_from_ui
params.description: Use this parameter to disable the shutdown server option from carbon management console UI.

params.name: disable_restart_from_ui
params.description: Use this parameter to disable the restart server option from carbon management console UI.

options.name: super_admin
options.description: This includes the configurations related to the super admin user.

params.name: username
params.description: super admin username

params.name: password
params.description: super admin password

params.name: create_admin_account
params.description: Set this to true to create a new user with the super admin details given.

options.name: database_configuration
options.description: Configurations required to enable browsing the H2 database from a web browser.

params.name: enable_h2_console
params.description: True when required to browser the H2 database from a browser. False when not.

options.name: database.apim_db
options.description: Database configurations related to API Manager

params.name: type
params.description: Database vendor

params.name: hostname
params.description: You can use either hostname and port or the URL(given below). If you specify the URL the hostname and port will be overridden.

params.name: url
params.description:
The connection URL is required when you use the h2 db.

 You have to add the URL to use the JDBC properties listed below. Otherwise it is optional.

params.name: username
params.description: The username used to create a connection to the database.

params.name: password
params.description: The password used to create a connection to the database.

params.name: validationQuery
params.description: The value changes according to the Database query

params.name: pool_options.maxActive
params.description: The maximum number of active connections that can be allocated from the connection pool at the same time. Change according to the preferred database.

params.name: pool_options.maxWait
params.description: The maximum time that requests are expected to wait in the queue for a connection to be released. This property comes into effect when the maximum number of active connections allowed in the connection pool (see maxActive property) is used up.

params.name: pool_options.testOnBorrow
params.description: The indication of whether connection objects will be validated before they are borrowed from the pool. If the object validation fails, the connection is dropped from the pool, and there will be an attempt to borrow another connection.

params.name: pool_options.validationInterval
params.description: This parameter controls how frequently a given validation query is executed (time in milliseconds). That is, if a connection is due for validation, but has been validated previously within this interval, it will not be validated again.

params.name: pool_options.defaultAutoCommit
params.description: When auto committing is enabled, each SQL statement will be committed to the database as an individual transaction, as opposed to committing multiple statements as a single transaction.

options.name: database.shared_db
options.description: Configurations related to the databases shared between nodes

params.name: type
params.description: Database type

params.name: url
params.description: connection url

params.name: username
params.description: username

params.name: password
params.description: password

options.name: apim.jwt
options.description: Enable APIM to generate a JWT within itself. JSON Web Token (JWT) is used to represent claims that are transferred between two parties such as the end-user and the backend.

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable JWT.

params.name: encoding
params.description: Use base64 encoding for the default JWT generator. Use the url-safe JWT generator if it is base64url.

params.name: generator_impl
params.description: This can be defined as a custom generation implmetation. If this is defined, the "apim.jwt.encoding" will be ignored. Note that this should be the fully-qualified class name.

params.name: header
params.description: The HTTP header name used to send the JWT generated prev.

params.name: enable_user_claims
params.description: No user store claims included in the JWT if false.

params.name: claims_extractor_impl
params.description: You can define the custom claim retiriver implmentation by adding the following apim.jwt.enable_user_claims=true. Make sure that it is the fully-qualified class name.

params.name: claim_dialect
params.description: A set of claims are identified as a dialect. Different dialects represent the same piece of information with different claim URIs.

params.name: signing_algorithm
params.description: Specify NONE to disbale the sigining.

options.name: apim.jwt.issuer
options.description: To specify the issuers of the JWT tokens if third-party Key Managers are used.

params.name: name
params.description: The issuer name of the JWT.

options.name: apim.jwt.issuer.jwks
options.description: To specify the JSON Web Key Set (JWKS) endpoint of the issuer.

params.name: url
params.description: The JWKS endpoint URL of the issuer.

params.name: remote_claim
params.description: The name of the remote claim.

params.name: local_claim
params.description: The local claim name that the remote claim needs to be mapped to.

params.name: display_in_api_console

params.description: E.g., ws://localhost:9099

configs.title: Virtual host of API-M gateway environment configurations

options.name: apim.gateway.environment.virtual_host
options.description: Configuring virtual host for the gateways environment.

params.name: http_endpoint
params.description: HTTP endpoint e.g. http://dev.wso2.com:8280

params.name: https_endpoint
params.description: HTTPS endpoint e.g. https://dev.wso2.com:8243

params.name: ws_endpoint
params.description: WS endpoint e.g. ws://dev.wso2.com:9099

params.name: wss_endpoint
params.description: WSS endpoint e.g. wss://dev.wso2.com:8099

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable the gateway token cache. WSO2 recommends to enable this feature by default. The token validation request checks with the cached value.

params.name: expiry_time
params.description: Set the cache expiry time in minutes. Recommended value is 15 minutes.

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable the gateway resource cache. Caches the API resources at the gateway. Expires in 15 minutes.

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable the Key Manager token cache. The token validation request checks with the value cached at the Key Manager. At any given time you should only have one cache enabled, which is either the Key Manager cache or the API Gateway cache. WSO2 does not recommend using both caches at the same time.

params.name: expiry_time
params.description: Set the cache expiry time.

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable cache for recently added apis in the API Developer Portal. This expires in 15 minutes by default.

params.name: enable
params.description: Enabel cache for scopes. This expires in 15 minutes by default.

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable cache for publisher roles. Expires in 15 minutes by default

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable JWT claim cache. The user's claims used to create the JWT are cached.

params.name: expiry_time
params.description: Set the cache expiry time. Would be same as the JWT expiry time.

params.name: expiry_time
params.description: Set when the tag cache expires. This option is disabled when not defined.

params.name: enable

params.name: store_api_url

 'event_publisher_impl = "org.wso2.carbon.apimgt.usage.publisher.APIMgtUsageDataBridgeDataPublisher"

Define each analytics node that the API Manager will connect to, as an array. If there are mutiple node, you need to define this configuration for each node.

options.name: apim.cors
options.description: Configures CORS headers on the Publisher and the Gateway.

params.name: enable
params.description: CORS configurations are enabled by default.

params.name: allow_origins
params.description: Denotes "Access-Control-Allow-Origin" response header. Specify an origin to share the response with.

params.name: allow_methods
params.description: Configures the methods allowed by the access control.

params.name: allow_headers
params.description: Configures the type of headers allowed by the access control.

params.name: allow_credentials
params.description:
Specifying this header to true means that the server allows cookies (or other user credentials) to be included on cross-origin requests.

 It is false by default and if you set it to true then make sure that the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header does not contain the wildcard (*)

options.name: apim.throttling
options.description: Configures API-M traffic control.

params.name: event_type
params.description: Binary - Uses the binary transport. Recommended.Thrift - Uses thrift tranport

params.name: receiver_url
params.description: Define traffic manager connection url inline. If none of this is defined consider it as "tcp://${carbon.local.ip}:${receiver.url.port}".

params.name: enable_header_based_throttling
params.description: Specifying this header to true will enable a user to define header condition throttling policies in the Admin Portal.

params.name: enable_unlimited_tier
params.description: Specifying this config to false will disable the unlimited throttling tier of basic throttling configurations.

params.name: enable_jwt_claim_based_throttling
params.description: Specifying this config to true will enable a user to define JWT claim based throttling policies in the Admin Portal.

params.name: enable_query_param_based_throttling
params.description: Specifying this config to true will enable a user to define Query parameter condition throttling policies in the Admin Portal.

params.name: skip_redeploying_policies
params.description: Define an array of throttle policies which don't need to redeploy on startup

params.name: enable_decision_connection
params.description: This will enable/disable the JMS Message retrieval connection based on the provided value(true/false).

params.name: enable_data_publishing
params.description: Enable publishing of request and throttling data.

params.name: enable_policy_deploy
params.description: Enable deploying of throttling policies.

params.name: enable_blacklist_condition
params.description: Enable blocking conditions from the admin portal.

params.name: enable_persistence
params.description: Enable persisting current counter state of the TM.

params.name: username
params.description: Credentials of the Traffic Manager user.

params.name: password
params.description: Credentials of the Traffic Manager user.

params.name: receiver_username
params.description: If the username of the receiver is different, use the username of the receiver configured on the Traffic Manager.

params.name: receiver_password
params.description: If the credentials of the receiver is different, use the password of the receiver configured on the Traffic Manager.

params.name: policy_deploy.username
params.description: If the credentials of the user is different, use the credentials of the user configured for deploying policies.

params.name: policy_deploy.password
params.description: If the credentials of the user is different, use the credentials of the user configured for deploying policies.

params.name: jms.username
params.description: If the credentials of the user is different, use the credentials of the user configured for the JMS connection.

params.name: jms.password
params.description: If the credentials of the user is different, use the credentials of the user configured for the JMS connection.

params.name: publisher.max_idle
params.description: Ideal values for the maximum no. of connections to the data publisher pool.

params.name: publisher.init_idle_size
params.description: Ideal values for the minimum no. of connections to the data publisher pool.

params.name: publisher.pool_size
params.description: The size of the thread pool in the API Publisher.

params.name: publisher.max_pool_size
params.description: The maximum size of the thread pool in the API Publisher.

params.name: publisher.keep_alive_time
params.description: The timeframe after which the publisher thread pool is terminated.

params.name: service_url
params.description: Service URL of the Traffic Manager.

params.name: blacklist_condition.start_delay
params.description: Define the delay time to get the blacklist conditions from the Keymanager.

params.name: jms.destination
params.description: JMS topic name

params.name: jms.start_delay
params.description: Connection delay to read the Traffic Manager at startup.

params.name: decision_connection_type
params.description: Define the JMS type e.g.,: andes

params.name: jms.java_naming_factory_initial
params.description: Define JMS factory initials. If decision_connection_type is andes, this is "org.wso2.andes.jndi.PropertiesFileInitialContextFactory"

params.name: throttle_decision_endpoints
params.description: Define array of JMS connection as an array.

params.name: traffic_manager_urls
params.description: [[apim.throttling.url_group]]traffic_manager_urls = ["tcp://localhost:9611","tcp://localhost:9611"]traffic_manager_auth_urls = ["ssl://localhost:9711","ssl://localhost:9711"]type = "loadbalance"

params.description: The maximum number of resources that can be charged with the given billing package.

params.name: overuse_charge
params.description: The charge for over usage based on the billing package.

options.description: This includes the bandwidth configurations related to the "SMB" billing package.

params.name: limit
params.description: The highest bandwidth value that can be allocated for the "SMB" billing package.

params.name: overuse_charge
params.description: The charge for over usage based on the billing package.

options.name: multi_tenancy.billing.package.custom
options.description: This includes multi-tenancy monetization configurations related to the custom package.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the custom billing package.

params.name: subscription_charge
params.description: The value of the subscription charge for the billing package.

options.name: multi_tenancy.billing.package.custom.users
options.description: This includes the users' configurations related to the custom billing package.

params.name: limit
params.description: Provides the number of users that can be attached to the custom billing package.

params.name: charge
params.description: Value of the subscription charge for the custom billing package per user.

options.name: multi_tenancy.billing.package.custom.resource_volume
options.description: This includes the resource volume configurations related to the custom billing package.

params.name: limit
params.description: The maximum number of resources that can be charged with the given billing package.

params.name: overuse_charge
params.description: The charge for over usage based on the billing package.

options.name: multi_tenancy.billing.package.custom.bandwidth
options.description: This includes the bandwidth configurations related to the custom billing package.

params.name: limit
params.description: The highest bandwidth value that can be allocated for the custom billing package.

params.name: overuse_charge
params.description: The charge for over usage based on the billing package.

options.name: indexing
options.description: Index configurations related to metadata search in registry.

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable registry indexing, which indexes the APIs in the registry. Required only to be true on the API Publisher and Developer Portal nodes. WSO2 recommends disabling this on other nodes (Gateways, Traffic Managers, and Key Managers).

params.name: starting_delay
params.description: Initial startup delay for indexing (when the server is starting) in seconds.

params.name: frequency
params.description: Indexing frequency in seconds.

params.name: bach_size
params.description: Number of resources submitted for given indexing thread.

params.name: pool_size
params.description: Number of worker threads for indexing.

params.name: re_indexing
params.description: Provide a number starting from 1. Increase the value by one during each time you need to reindex. Make sure to backup and delete the <API-M_HOME>/solr directory after changing the configuration and before restarting the server. After a server restart, reindexing might take a considerable amount of time depending on the number of APIs you have in the registry.

options.name: transport.http.properties
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the parameters that are used for tuning the default HTTP catalina server transport of the API Manager.

options.name: transport.https.properties
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the parameters that are used for tuning the default HTTPS catalina server transport of the API Manager.

options.name: transport.passthru_http
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the parameters that are used for tuning the default HTTP/S passthrough transport of the API Manager in non-blocking mode.

params.name: http.socket.timeout
params.description: This is the maximum period of inactivity between two consecutive data packets, specified in milliseconds.

params.name: worker_pool_size_core
params.description: The API Manager uses a thread pool executor to create threads and to handle incoming requests. This parameter controls the number of core threads used by the executor pool. If you increase this parameter value, the number of requests received that can be processed by the gateway increases, hence, the throughput also increases. The nature of the integration scenario and the number of concurrent requests received by the gateway are the main factors that helps to determine this parameter.

params.name: worker_pool_size_max
params.description: This is the maximum number of threads in the worker thread pool. Specifying a maximum limit avoids performance degradation that can occur due to context switching. If the specified value is reached, you will see the error 'SYSTEM ALERT - HttpServerWorker threads were in BLOCKED state during last minute'. This can occur due to an extraordinarily high number of requests sent at a time when all the threads in the pool are busy, and the maximum number of threads is already reached.

params.name: worker_pool_queue_length
params.description: This defines the length of the queue that is used to hold runnable tasks to be executed by the worker pool. The thread pool starts queuing jobs when all the existing threads are busy, and the pool has reached the maximum number of threads. The value for this parameter should be -1 to use an unbound queue. If a bound queue is used and the queue gets filled to its capacity, any further attempts to submit jobs fail causing some messages to be dropped by Synapse.

params.name: io_buffer_size
params.description: This is the value of the memory buffer allocated when reading data into the memory from the underlying socket/file channels. You should leave this property set to the default value.

params.name: http.max.connection.per.host.port
params.description: This defines the maximum number of connections allowed per host port.

params.name: http.user.agent.preserve
params.description: If this parameter is set to true, the user-agent HTTP header of messages passing through the integrator is preserved and printed in the outgoing message.

params.name: http.headers.preserve
params.description: This parameter allows you to specify the header field/s of messages passing through the EI that need to be preserved and printed in the outgoing message such as Location, CommonsHTTPTransportSenderKeep-Alive, Date, Server, User-Agent, and Host. For example, http.headers.preserve = Location, Date, Server.

params.name: disable_connection_keepalive
params.description: If this parameter is set to true, the HTTP connections with the back end service are closed soon after the request is served. It is recommended to set this property to false so that the integrator does not have to create a new connection every time it sends a request to a back-end service. However, you may need to close connections after they are used if the back-end service does not provide sufficient support for keep-alive connections.

params.name: listener.parameters.port
params.description: The port on which this transport receiver should listen for incoming messages.

params.name: listener.parameters.WSDLEPRPrefix
params.description: A URL prefix which will be added to all service EPRs and EPRs in WSDLs etc.

params.name: listener.parameters.port
params.description: The secured port on which this transport receiver should listen for incoming messages.

params.name: listener.key_store.file_name
params.description: The path to the keystore file that is used for securing the HTTP passthrough connection. By default, the keystore file of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: listener.key_store.type
params.description: The type of the keystore file. By default, the keystore type of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: listener.key_store.password
params.description: The password of the keystore file that is used for securing the HTTP passthrough connection. This keystore password is used when accessing the keys in the keystore. By default, the keystore password of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: listener.key_store.key_password
params.description: The password of the private key that is used for securing the HTTP passthrough connection. This keystore password is used when accessing the keys in the keystore. By default, the keystore password of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: listener.trust_store.file_name
params.description: The path to the keystore file that is used for storing the trusted digital certificates. By default, the product's trust store is configured for this purpose.

params.name: listener.trust_store.type
params.description: The type of the keystore file that is used as the trust store. By default, the product's trust store is configured for this purpose.

params.name: listener.trust_store.password
params.description: The password of the keystore file that is used as the trust store. By default, the product's trust store is configured for this purpose.

params.name: sender.warnOnHTTP500
params.description: If the outgoing messages should be sent through an HTTP proxy server, use this parameter to specify the target proxy.

params.name: sender.http.proxyHost
params.description: If the outgoing messages should be sent through an HTTP proxy server, use this parameter to specify the target proxy.

params.name: sender.http.proxyPort
params.description: The port through which the target proxy (specified by the 'sender.proxy_port' parameter) accepts HTTP traffic.

params.name: sender.http.nonProxyHosts
params.description: The list of hosts to which the HTTP traffic should be sent directly without going through the proxy. When trying to add multiple hostnames along with an asterisk in order to define a set of sub-domains for non-proxy hosts, you need to add a period before the asterisk when configuring proxy server.

params.name: sender.hostname_verifier
params.description: The list of hosts to which the HTTP traffic should be sent directly without going through the proxy. When trying to add multiple hostnames along with an asterisk in order to define a set of sub-domains for non-proxy hosts, you need to add a period before the asterisk when configuring proxy server.

params.name: sender.key_store.file_name
params.description: The path to the keystore file that is used for securing the HTTP passthrough connection. By default, the keystore file of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: sender.key_store.type
params.description: The type of the keystore file. By default, the keystore type of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: sender.key_store.password
params.description: The password of the keystore file that is used for securing the HTTP passthrough connection. This keystore password is used when accessing the keys in the keystore. By default, the keystore password of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: sender.key_store.key_password
params.description: The password of the private key that is used for securing the HTTP passthrough connection. This keystore password is used when accessing the keys in the keystore. By default, the keystore password of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: sender.trust_store.file_name
params.description: The path to the keystore file that is used for storing the trusted digital certificates. By default, the product's trust store is configured for this purpose.

params.name: sender.trust_store.type
params.description: The type of the keystore file that is used as the trust store. By default, the product's trust store is configured for this purpose.

params.name: sender.trust_store.password
params.description: The password of the keystore file that is used as the trust store. By default, the product's trust store is configured for this purpose.

options.name: transport.passthru_https
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the parameters that are used for configuring the default HTTP/S passthrough transport in blocking mode

params.name: listener.enable
params.description: This parameter is used for enabling the HTTP passthrough transport listener in blocking mode.

params.name: listener.parameters.port
params.description: The port on which this transport receiver should listen for incoming messages.

params.name: sender.enable
params.description: This parameter is used for enabling the HTTP passthrough transport sender in blocking mode.

params.name: sender.parameters.cacheHttpClient
params.description: This parameter is used to specify whether the HTTP client should save cache entries and the cached responses in the JVM memory or not.

params.name: sender.parameters.Transfer-Encoding
params.description: This parameter enables you to specify whether the data sent should be chunked. It can be used instead of the Content-Length header if you want to upload data without having to know the amount of data to be uploaded in advance.

params.name: sender.parameters.defaultMaxConnectionsPerHost
params.description: The maximum number of connections that will be created per host server by the client. If the backend server is slow, the connections in use at a given time will take a long time to be released and added back to the connection pool. As a result, connections may not be available for some requests. In such situations, it is recommended to increase the value for this parameter.

params.name: sender.parameters.OmitSOAP12Action
params.description: If following is set to 'true', optional action part of the Content-Type will not be added to the SOAP 1.2 messages.

params.name: sender.parameters.SO_TIMEOUT
params.description: If following is set to 'true', optional action part of the Content-Type will not be added to the SOAP 1.2 messages.

params.name: sender.http.proxyHost
params.description: If the outgoing messages should be sent through an HTTP proxy server (in blocking mode), use this parameter to specify the target proxy.

params.name: sender.http.proxyPort
params.description: The port through which the target proxy (specified by the 'sender.proxy_host' parameter) accepts HTTP traffic (in blocking mode).

params.name: sender.http.proxyHost
params.description: If the outgoing messages should be sent through an HTTPS proxy server (in blocking mode), use this parameter to specify the target proxy.

params.name: sender.http.proxyPort
params.description: The port through which the target proxy (specified by the 'sender.secured_proxy_host' parameter) accepts HTTPS traffic (in blocking mode).

options.name: [transport.passthru_http.sender.parameters]
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring HTTP proxy profiles when you need multiple proxy servers to route messages to different endpoints.

params.name: proxyProfiles
params.description: Attribute to define a full proxy profile. Following fields describes the elements used inside the profile

params.name: targetHosts
params.description: A host name or a comma-separated list of host names for a target endpoint. Host names can be specified as regular expressions that match a pattern. When asterisks (*) is specified as the target hostname, it will match all the hosts in the profile.

params.name: proxyHost
params.description: The host name of the proxy server.

params.name: proxyPort
params.description: The port number of the proxy server.

params.name: proxyUserName
params.description: The username for authenticating the proxy server.

params.name: proxyPassword
params.description: The password for authenticating the proxy server.

options.name: [transport.passthru_https.sender.parameters]
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring HTTP proxy profiles when you need multiple proxy servers to route messages to different endpoints.

params.name: proxyProfiles
params.description: Attribute to define a full proxy profile. Following fields describes the elements used inside the profile

params.name: targetHosts
params.description: A host name or a comma-separated list of host names for a target endpoint. Host names can be specified as regular expressions that match a pattern. When asterisks (*) is specified as the target hostname, it will match all the hosts in the profile.

params.name: proxyHost
params.description: The host name of the proxy server.

params.name: proxyPort
params.description: The port number of the proxy server.

params.name: proxyUserName
params.description: The username for authenticating the proxy server.

params.name: proxyPassword
params.description: The password for authenticating the proxy server.

options.name: transport.ws
options.description: This configuration header groups the parameters that configure the API Manager to communicate through the Websocket transport.

params.name: sender.enable
params.description: The parameter for enabling the websocket transport listener.

params.name: sender.parameters.ws.outflow.dispatch.sequence
params.description: The sequence for the back-end to client mediation.

params.name: sender.parameters.ws.outflow.dispatch.fault.sequence
params.description: The fault sequence for the back-end to client mediation path.

params.name: sender.parameter.customParameter
params.description: Replace 'customParameter' with required parameter name.

options.name: transport.wss
options.description: This configuration header groups the parameters that configure the API Manager to communicate through the secured Websocket transport.

params.name: sender.enable
params.description: The parameter for enabling the websocket secured transport sender.

params.name: sender.parameters.ws.outflow.dispatch.sequence
params.description: The sequence for the back-end to client mediation.

params.name: sender.parameters.ws.outflow.dispatch.fault.sequence
params.description: The fault sequence for the back-end to client mediation path.

params.name: sender.trust_store.location
params.description: The file path to the truststore that stores the trusted digital certificates for websocket use cases. By default, the product's trust store is configured for this purpose.

params.name: sender.trust_store.password
params.description: The password of the keystore file that is used as the trust store.

params.name: sender.parameter.customParameter
params.description: Replace 'customParameter' with required parameter name.

options.name: message_builders
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the implementation that is used to build messages that are received by the API Manager in the default non-blocking mode.

params.name: application_xml
params.description: The message builder implementation that builds messages with the 'application_xml' content type. If required, you can change the default builder class.

params.name: form_urlencoded
params.description: The message builder implementation that builds messages with the 'form_urlencoded' content type. If required, you can change the default builder class.

params.name: multipart_form_data
params.description: The message builder implementation that builds messages with the 'multipart_form_data' content type. If required, you can change the default builder class.

params.name: text_plain
params.description: The message builder implementation that builds messages with the 'text_plain' content type. If required, you can change the default builder class.

params.name: application_json
params.description: The message builder implementation that builds messages with the 'application_json' content type. If required, you can change the default builder class.

params.name: json_badgerfish
params.description: The message builder implementation that builds messages with the 'json_badgerfish' content type. If required, you can change the default builder class.

params.name: text_javascript
params.description: The message builder implementation that builds messages with the 'text_javascript' content type. If required, you can change the default builder class.

params.name: octet_stream
params.description: The message builder implementation that builds messages with the 'octet_stream' content type. If required, you can change the default builder class.

params.name: application_binary
params.description: The message builder implementation that builds messages with the 'application_binary' content type. If required, you can change the default builder class.

options.name: blocking.message_builders
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the message builder implementation that is used to build messages that are received by the API Manager in blocking mode. You can use the same list of parameters that are available for message builders in non-blocking mode.

options.name: message_formatters
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the message formatting implementation that is used for formatting messages that are sent out of the API Manager in non-blocking mode.

params.name: application_xml
params.description: The message formating implementation that formats messages with the 'application_xml' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

params.name: form_urlencoded
params.description: The message formating implementation that formats messages with the 'form_urlencoded' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

params.name: multipart_form_data
params.description: The message formating implementation that formats messages with the 'multipart_form_data' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

params.name: text_plain
params.description: The message formating implementation that formats messages with the 'text_plain' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

params.name: application_json
params.description: The message formating implementation that formats messages with the 'application_json' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

params.name: json_badgerfish
params.description: The message formating implementation that formats messages with the 'json_badgerfish' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

params.name: text_javascript
params.description: The message formating implementation that formats messages with the 'text_javascript' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

params.name: octet_stream
params.description: The message formatting implementation that formats messages with the 'octet_stream' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

params.name: application_binary
params.description: The message formating implementation that formats messages with the 'application_binary' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

params.name: text_xml
params.description: The message formating implementation that formats messages with the 'text_xml' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

params.name: soap_xml
params.description: The message formating implementation that formats messages with the 'soap_xml' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

options.name: blocking.message_formatters
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the message formatter implementations that are used to format messages that are sent out from the API Manager in blocking mode. You can use the same list of parameters that are available for message formatters in non-blocking mode.

options.name: [custom_message_builders]
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the custom message builder implementation class and the selected content types to which the builder should apply in non-blocking mode.

params.name: content_type
params.description: The content types to which the custom message builder implementation should apply. You can specify the list of content types as follows: application/json/badgerfish.

params.name: class
params.description: The custom message builder implementation that should apply to the given content types.

options.name: [blocking.custom_message_builders]
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the custom message builder implementation class and the selected content types to which the builder should apply in blocking mode. You can use the same list of parameters that are available for custom message builders in non-blocking mode.

options.name: [custom_message_formatters]
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the custom message formatter implementation class and the selected content types to which the formatter should apply in non-blocking mode.

params.name: content_type
params.description: The content types to which the custom message formatter implementation should apply. You can specify the list of content types as follows: application/json/badgerfish.

params.name: class
params.description: The custom message formatter implementation that should apply to the given content types.

options.name: [blocking.custom_message_formatters]
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the custom message formatter implementation class and the selected content types to which the formatter should apply in blocking mode. You can use the same list of parameters that are available for custom message formatters in non-blocking mode.

options.name: mediation
options.description: This configuration header groups the parameters used for tuning the mediation process (Synapse engine) of the API Manager. These parameters are mainly used when mediators such as Iterate and Clone (which uses the internal thread pools) are used.

params.name: synapse.core_threads
params.description: The initial number of synapse threads in the pool. This parameter is applicable only if the Iterate and Clone mediators are used to handle a higher load. These mediators use a thread pool to create new threads when processing messages and sending messages in parallal. You can configure the size of the thread pool by this parameter. The number of threads specified via this parameter should be increased as required to balance an increased load. Increasing the value specified for this parameter results in higher performance of the Iterate and Clone mediators.

params.name: synapse.max_threads
params.description: The maximum number of synapse threads in the pool. This parameter is applicable only if the Iterate and Clone mediators are used to handle a higher load. The number of threads specified for this parameter should be increased as required to balance an increased load.

params.name: synapse.threads_queue_length
params.description: The length of the queue that is used to hold the runnable tasks that are to be executed by the pool. This parameter is applicable only if the Iterate and Clone mediators are used to handle a higher load. You can specify a finite value as the queue length by giving any positive number. If this parameter is set to (-1) it means that the task queue length is infinite. If the queue length is finite, there can be situations where requests are rejected when the task queue is full and all the cores are occupied. If the queue length is infinite, and if some thread locking happens, the server can go out of memory. Therefore, you need to decide on an optimal value based on the actual load.

params.name: synapse.global_timeout_interval
params.description: The maximum number of milliseconds within which a response for the request should be received. A response that arrives after the specified number of seconds cannot be correlated with the request. Hence, a warning will be logged and the request will be dropped. This parameter is also referred to as the time-out handler.

params.name: synapse.enable_xpath_dom_failover
params.description: If this parameter is set to true, the Micro Integrator can switch to XPATH 2.0. This parameter can be set to false if XPATH 2.0 evaluations cause performance degradation. The Micro Integrator uses the Saxon Home Edition when implementing XPATH 2.0 functionalities, and thus supports all the functions that are shipped with it. For more information on the supported functions, see the Saxon Documentation.

params.name: synapse.temp_data_chunk_size
params.description: The message size that can be processed by the Micro Integrator.

params.name: synapse.script_mediator_pool_size
params.description: When using externally referenced scripts, this parameter specifies the size of the script engine pool that should be used per script mediator. The script engines from this pool are used for externally referenced script execution where updates to external scripts on an engine currently in use may otherwise not be thread safe. It is recommended to keep this value at a reasonable size since there will be a pool per externally referenced script.

params.name: synapse.preserve_namespace_on_xml_to_json
params.description: Preserves the namespace declarations in the JSON output during XML to JSON message transformations.

params.name: flow.statistics.enable
params.description:
Set this property to true and enable statistics for the required integration artifact to record information such as the following:
  • The time spent on each mediator.
  • The time spent on processing each message.
  • The fault count of a single message flow.

params.name: flow.statistics.enable
params.description: Set this property to 'true' and set the flow.statistics.enable property also to 'true'. This will enable mediation statistics for all the integration artifacts by default. If you set this property to 'false', you need to set the flow.statistics.enable property to 'true' and manually enable statistics for the required integration artifact.

params.name: statistics.enable_clean
params.description: If this parameter is set to true, all the existing statistics would be cleared before processing a request. This is recommended if you want to increase the processing speed.

params.name: stat.tracer.collect_payloads
params.description: Set this property to true and enable tracing for the required integration artifact to record the message payload before and after the message mediation performed by individual mediators.

params.name: stat.tracer.collect_mediation_properties
params.description:
Set this property to true and enable tracing for the required integration artifact to record the following information:
  • Message context properties.
  • Message transport-scope properties.

options.name: [synapse_handlers]
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring a synapse handler with the name and the implementation class.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the synapse handler.

params.name: class
params.description: The synapse handler implementation.

options.name: governance
options.description: This includes configurations related to underlying governance registry in API-M.

params.name: life_cycle_checklist_items_enabled
params.description: Enable lifecycle checklist items.

options.name: qpid.heartbeat
options.description: This includes configurations related to the frequency of the internal heartbeat sent by the underlying Qpid brocker component of Traffic Manager. You need to to configure a proper delay for the heartbeat value if the connections will stay idle for a long time.

params.name: delay
params.description: This defines an interval (in seconds) between the pings sent to a subscriber to keep the connection alive.

params.name: timeoutFactor
params.description: The time duration (in seconds) allowed for a subscriber to respond to a heartbeat request. If this time elapses before the response is received, the channel of communication between the server and the subscriber will end.

options.name: carbon_health_check
options.description: This includes configurations related to carbon health check API.

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable carbon health checker.

options.name: carbon_health_check.health_checker.super_tenant_health_checker
options.description: This includes configurations related to super tenant userstore health check.

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable user store health checker.

params.name: order
params.description: The execution order.

options.name: carbon_health_check.health_checker.super_tenant_health_checker.properties
options.description: This includes properties related to super tenant userstore health check.

params.name: monitored.user.stores
params.description: An array of domain names of the userstores to monitor health. If not given, health is monitered on all the super tenant secondary user stores.

options.name: carbon_health_check.health_checker.data_source_health_checker
options.description: This includes configurations related to the health check of data sources which are configured in master-datasources by checking the connection pool information and by getting a connection from the pool.

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable datasource health checker.

params.name: order
params.description: The execution order.

options.name: carbon_health_check.health_checker.data_source_health_checker.properties
options.description: This includes properties related to datastore health check.

params.name: pool_usage_limit_percentage
params.description: Datasource connection pool usage

params.name: monitored.datasources
params.description: An array of jndiConfig names of datasources to monitor health. If not given, health is monitered on all the datastores.

options.name: health_checker
options.description: This includes configurations related to adding custom health checkers.

params.name: name
params.description: The custom health checker name.

params.name: order
params.description: The custom health checker execution order.

params.name: properties
params.description: The custom health checker properties. Provide as key value pairs.

options.name: oauth
options.description: This includes OAuth configurations in API-M.

params.name: additional_params_from_error_url
params.description: Allow additional parameters in OAuth2 error url.

params.name: allowed_scopes
params.description: Configuration to pass a list of scopes which are allowed without any validation.

params.name: timestamp_skew
params.description: Time stamp skew in seconds.

params.name: extensions.token_generator
params.description: Token Issuer class.

params.name: extensions.token_context_generator
params.description: Token Issuer class for Authorization Context.

params.name: extensions.token_context_claim_retriever
params.description: Claim Retriever Implementation class for Authorization Context.

params.name: extensions.token_context_dialect_uri
params.description: Consumer Dialect URI for Authorization Context.

options.name: oauth.token_validation
options.description: This includes configurations for OAuth token validation.

params.name: app_access_token_validity
params.description: Default validity period for application access tokens in seconds.

params.name: user_access_token_validity
params.description: Default validity period for user access tokens in seconds.

params.name: refresh_token_validity
params.description: Default validity period for refresh tokens in seconds.

options.name: oauth.token_cleanup
options.description: This includes OAuth configurations for old, invalid token cleanup in API-M.

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable token cleanup.

params.name: retain_access_tokens_for_auditing
params.description: Set this to true, to move the old, invalid tokens to the Audit table when token cleaning is enabled. Set this to false, if you do not wish to store old tokens in the Audit table.

options.name: oauth.oidc
options.description: This includes configurations related to OpenID Connect authorization server in API-M.

params.name: extensions.id_token_builder
params.description: IDToken builder implementation class.

params.name: extensions.claim_callback_handler
params.description: This can be used to return extra custom claims with the IDToken . You can implement a claims call back handler to push the custom claims to the IDToken implmenting interface CustomClaimsCallbackHandler.

params.name: extensions.user_info_claim_retriever
params.description: Defines the class which builds the claims for the User Info Endpoint's response. This class needs to implement the interface UserInfoClaimRetriever.

params.name: user_info.response_type
params.description: The value that is set to get JWT response from user info endpoint.

params.name: token_validation.id_token_validity
params.description: The expiration value of the IDToken in seconds.

params.name: id_token.issuer
params.description: The value of issuer of the IDToken. This should be changed according to the deployment values.

params.name: id_token.redirect_error_page
params.description: Send the response to OAuth2 error page.

params.name: claims.enable_oidc_dialect
params.description: Enable converting original claims from assertions to OIDC Dialect.

params.name: claims.enable_unmapped_user_attributes
params.description: Enable adding unmapped user attributes.

options.name: oauth.grant_type
options.description: This includes configurations for supported OAuth grant types in API-M.

params.name: authorization_code.enable
params.description: Enable Authorization Code grant.

params.name: authorization_code.grant_handler
params.description: Authorization Code grant implementation class.

params.name: password.enable
params.description: Enable Password grant.

params.name: password.grant_handler
params.description: Password grant implementation class.

params.name: refresh_token.enable
params.description: Enable Refresh Token grant.

params.name: refresh_token.grant_handler
params.description: Refresh Token grant implementation class.

params.name: client_credentials.enable
params.description: Enable Refresh Token grant.

params.name: client_credentials.grant_handler
params.description: Client Credentials grant implementation class.

params.name: client_credentials.allow_refresh_tokens
params.description: Enable to allow refresh tokens for client credentails grant.

params.name: client_credentials.allow_id_token
params.description: Enable to allow ID tokens for client credentails grant.

params.name: saml_bearer.enable
params.description: Enable SAML2 Bearer grant.

params.name: saml_bearer.grant_handler
params.description: SAML2 Bearer grant implementation class.

params.name: iwa_ntlm.enable
params.description: Enable NTLM grant.

params.name: iwa_ntlm.grant_handler
params.description: NTLM grant implementation class.

params.name: iwa_ntlm.grant_validator
params.description: NTLM grant validator implementation class.

params.name: jwt_bearer.enable
params.description: Enable JWT Bearer grant.

params.name: jwt_bearer.grant_handler
params.description: JWT Bearer grant implementation class.

params.name: jwt_bearer.grant_validator
params.description: JWT Bearer grant validator implementation class.

params.name: kerberos.enable
params.description: Enable Kerberos Bearer grant.

params.name: kerberos.grant_handler
params.description: Kerberos grant implementation class.

params.name: kerberos.grant_validator
params.description: Kerberos grant validator implementation class.

options.name: session_data.persistence
options.description: This includes configuration for session data persistence of tokens.

params.name: persistence_pool_size
params.description: This value determines the number of threads in the thread pool that are used to consume the token persisting queue. Set the value 0 to enable synchronous token persistence. Set the value higher than 0 to enable asynchronous token persistence.

options.name: oauth.token_generation
options.description: This includes configuration for OAuth2 token persistence.

params.name: retry_count_on_persistence_failures
params.description: This indicates how many times to retry in the event of a CONN_APP_KEY violation when storing the access token.

params.name: MaxUserNameListLength
params.description: Controls the number of users listed in the user store of a WSO2 product. This is useful when you have a large number of users and don't want to list them all. Setting this property to 0 displays all users.

params.name: ConnectionURL
params.description: Connection URL to the user store server. In the case of default LDAP in Carbon, the port is specified in the carbon.xml file, and a reference to that port is included in this configuration.

params.name: ConnectionName
params.description: The username used to connect to the database and perform various operations. This user does not have to be an administrator in the user store or have an administrator role in the WSO2 product that you are using, but this user MUST have permissions to read the user list and users' attributes and to perform search operations on the user store. The value you specify is used as the DN ( Distinguish Name ) attribute of the user. This property is mandatory.

params.name: ConnectionPassword
params.description: Password for the ConnectionName user.

params.name: DisplayNameAttribute
params.description: This is an optional property. The Display Name Attribute is the name by which users will be listed when you search for users in the management console (Go to Configuration -> Users tab).

params.name: PasswordHashMethod
params.description: Password hash method to use when storing user entries in the user store.

params.name: UserNameListFilter
params.description: Filtering criteria for listing all the user entries in the user store. This query or filter is used when doing search operations on users. In this case, the search operation only provides the objects created from the specified class. This query is the same as listing out all the available users in the management console.

params.name: UserEntryObjectClass
params.description: Object class used to construct user entries. By default, it is a custom object class defined with the name wso2Person .

params.name: UserSearchBase
params.description: DN of the context or object under which the user entries are stored in the user store. In this case, it is the "users" container. When the user store searches for users, it will start from this location of the directory. Different databases have different search bases.

params.name: UserNameSearchFilter
params.description: Filtering criteria used to search for a particular user entry.

params.name: UserNameAtribute
params.description: The attribute used for uniquely identifying a user entry. Users can be authenticated using their email address, UID, etc. The name of the attribute is considered as the username.

params.name: PasswordJavaScriptRegEx
params.description: Policy that defines the password format.

params.name: UsernameJavaScriptRegEx
params.description: The regular expression used by the front-end components for username validation.

params.name: UsernameJavaRegEx
params.description: A regular expression to validate usernames. By default, strings have a length of 5 to 30. Only non-empty characters are allowed. You can provide ranges of alphabets, numbers and also ranges of ASCII values in the RegEx properties.

params.name: PasswordJavaRegEx
params.description: (LDAP and JDBC) A regular expression to validate passwords. By default, strings having a length between 5 to 30 with non-empty characters are allowed.

params.name: RolenameJavaRegEx
params.description: A regular expression to validate role names. By default, strings having a length between 5 to 30 with non-empty characters are allowed.

params.name: ReadGroups
params.description: Specifies whether groups should be read from the user store. If this is disabled by setting it to false , none of the groups in the user store can be read, and the following group configurations are NOT mandatory: GroupSearchBase , GroupNameListFilter , or GroupNameAttribute .

params.name: WriteGroups
params.description: Specifies whether groups should be written to user store.

params.name: GroupSearchBase
params.description: DN of the context under which user entries are stored in the user store.

params.name: GroupNameListFilter
params.description: Filtering criteria for listing all the group entries in the user store. Groups are created in LDAP using the "groupOfName" class. The group search operation only returns objects created from this class.

params.name: GroupEntryObjectClass
params.description: Object class used to construct group entries.

params.name: GroupNameSearchFilter
params.description: Filtering criteria used to search for a particular group entry.

params.name: GroupNameAttribute
params.description: Attribute used for uniquely identifying a user entry. This attribute is to be treated as the group name.

params.name: MembershipAttribute
params.description: Attribute used to define members of groups.

params.name: MembershipAttributeRange
params.description: Attribute used by Active Directories where they need limit membership attributes. The default value for this is 1500.

params.name: UserRoleCacheEnabled
params.description: This is to indicate whether to cache the role list of a user. By default this is set to true . Set it to false if the user roles are changed by external means and those changes should be instantly reflected in the Carbon instance.

params.name: UserDNPattern
params.description: (LDAP) The patten for the user's DN, which can be defined to improve the search. When there are many user entries in the LDAP user store, defining a UserDNPattern provides more impact on performances as the LDAP does not have to travel through the entire tree to find users.

params.name: ReplaceEscapeCharactersAtUserLogin
params.description: (LDAP) If the user name has special characters it replaces it to validate the user logging in. Only " \ " and " \\ " are identified as escape characters.

params.name: MultiTenantRealmConfigBuilder
params.description: Tenant Manager specific realm config parameter. Can be used to build different types of realms for the tenant.

params.name: LDAPConnectionTimeout
params.description: If the connection to an LDAP is inactive for the length of time (in milliseconds) specified by this property, the connection will be terminated.

params.name: SCIMEnabled
params.description: This is to configure whether user store is supported for SCIM provisioning.

params.name: kdcEnabled
params.description: If your user store is capable of acting as a Kerberos, Key Distribution Center (KDC) and if you like to enable it, set this property to true.

params.name: ConnectionPoolingEnabled
params.description: Define whether LDAP connection pooling is enabled

params.name: ReadTimeout
params.description: The value of this property is the read timeout in milliseconds for LDAP operations. If the LDAP provider cannot get a LDAP response within that period, it aborts the read attempt. The integer should be greater than zero. An integer less than or equal to zero means no read timeout is specified which is equivalent to waiting for the response infinitely until it is received.

params.name: RetryAttempts
params.description: Retry the authentication request if a timeout happened

params.name: BackLinksEnabled
params.description: Defines whether the backlink support is enabled. If you are using MemberOfAttribute attributes this should be set to true.

params.name: UserCoreCacheTimeOut
params.description: User core cache expiration duration

options.name: synapse_handlers.custom_handler_name
options.description: configuration used to define or enable disable global handler.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Enable or disable a defined global handler.

params.name: class
params.description: Fully qualified class name of the global handler.
